text: 今回の事件の唯一の当事者である / 初号機パイロットの直接尋問を拒否したそうだな / カツラギさんさん / はい
translation: I hear you refused the direct interrogation of the Unit-01 pilot, the sole party involved in this incident. / Katsuragi-san. / Yes.
grammar: である is a formal copula used in official/written contexts, equivalent to だ but more authoritative.

text: 彼の情緒は大変不安定です / 今ここに立つことが良策とは思えません / では聞こう 代理人 桂木さんさ
translation: His emotional state is very unstable. / I don't think it would be a good idea for him to stand here now. / Then let me ask you, as his representative, Katsuragi-san.
grammar: とは思えません expresses 'I cannot think that...' - a polite way to disagree or express doubt.

text: さっきの事件 使徒が我々人類にコンタクトを試みたのではないのかね
translation: In this recent incident, wasn't the Angel attempting to make contact with us humans?
grammar: のではないのかね is a rhetorical question form used by superiors, implying 'isn't it the case that...?'

text: 被験者の報告からはそれを感じ取れません / イレギュラーな事件だと推定されます
translation: We cannot discern that from the test subject's report. / It is presumed to be an irregular incident.
grammar: される is the passive form, commonly used in formal/scientific contexts to express objectivity.

text: 彼の記憶が正しいとすればな / 記憶の外的操作は認められませんが / エヴァのACレコーダーは作動していなかった 確認は取れまい
translation: That's if his memory is correct. / No external manipulation of his memory was detected, but... / The Eva's AC recorder wasn't functioning, so we probably can't confirm it.
grammar: まい expresses negative conjecture or probability ('probably won't/can't'), often used in formal speech.

text: 使徒は人間の精神 心に興味を持ったのかね / その返答はできかねます / 果たして使徒に心の概念があるのか / 人間の思考が理解できるのか 全く不明ですから
translation: Did the Angel become interested in the human psyche, the heart? / I cannot answer that. / Whether Angels even have a concept of 'heart,' or whether they can understand human thought, is completely unknown.
grammar: できかねます is a polite refusal meaning 'I am unable to...' - softer than できません.

text: 今回の事件には 使徒がエヴァを取り込もうとしたという / 新たな要素がある
translation: In this incident, there is a new element: the Angel attempted to absorb the Eva.
grammar: という introduces reported speech or explanation of what something is.

text: これが予測される第13使徒以降と リンクする可能性は? / これまでのパターンから / 使徒同士の組織的な繋がりは 否定されます / さよう、
translation: Is there a possibility this links to the predicted 13th Angel and beyond? / Based on patterns so far, / organizational connections between Angels are ruled out. / Indeed.
grammar: 同士 (どうし) attached to nouns means 'between each other' or 'among themselves.'

text: 単独行動であることは明らかだ。これまではな。 / それは / どういうことなのでしょうか? / 君の質問は許されない。 / はい。 / 以上だ。下がりたまえ。 / はい。
translation: It's clear they act independently. Until now, that is. / What do you mean by that? / Your questions are not permitted. / Yes sir. / That will be all. You may step down. / Yes sir.
grammar: 下がりたまえ uses たまえ, an old-fashioned imperative form used by superiors to subordinates.

text: どう思うかね、怒り君。 / 使徒は知恵を身につき始めています。 / 残された時間は、 / あとわずかということか。
translation: What do you think, Ikari? / The Angels are beginning to acquire wisdom. / The time remaining... / Is running short, you mean?
grammar: 始めています uses V-stem + 始める to express 'starting to do' something.

text: 12号室のクランケー? / AのE事件の救急でしょ? / ここで入院してからずいぶん経つわね / なかなか難しいみたいよ、あの怪我 / まだ小学生なのに / 今日も来てるんでしょ、あの子
translation: The patient in Room 12? / The emergency case from the A-E incident? / It's been quite a while since she was admitted here. / That injury seems quite difficult to treat. / And she's still just an elementary school student. / He's here today too, isn't he?
grammar: ずいぶん means 'quite a lot' or 'considerably,' emphasizing degree.

text: そうそう / 週2回は必ず顔出してるのよ / 妹思いのいいお兄さんよね / ほんと? / 今時珍しいわね、あんな男の子
translation: That's right. / He comes by at least twice a week without fail. / Such a caring older brother who thinks of his sister. / Really? / Boys like that are rare these days.
grammar: 今時 (いまどき) means 'nowadays' or 'these days,' often used with contrast.

text: レイ、今日はいいのか? / はい明日赤木博士のところに行きます明後日は学校へ / 学校はどうだ / 問題ありませんそう / かならばいい
translation: Rei, is today alright? / Yes, tomorrow I'll go see Dr. Akagi. The day after, I'll go to school. / How is school? / No problems. / I see. That's good then.
grammar: ならばいい is a formal conditional meaning 'if that's the case, it's fine.'

text: 起立! / 着席!
translation: Stand! / Be seated!
grammar: These are command forms commonly used in Japanese schools at the start and end of class.

text: ああ今日の休みはいつもの綾波と間か。 / ケンスケ、どうしたの?
translation: Ah, today's absences are the usual Ayanami and Maki? / Kensuke, what's up?
grammar: どうしたの is a casual way to ask 'what's wrong?' or 'what happened?'

text: 新横須賀。今日も戦艦の追っかけや。
translation: Shin-Yokosuka. He's chasing battleships again today.
grammar: や at the end is Kansai dialect, equivalent to だ or です.

text: 妙子とかユンが入港しとるんやと。 / 鈴原。 / あ、はい、はい。 / 後で綾波にプリントを届けておくように。 / はい。
translation: The Myoko and the Yun are in port, apparently. / Suzuhara. / Ah, yes, yes. / Make sure to deliver the handouts to Ayanami later. / Yes.
grammar: しとる is Kansai dialect for している. やと is Kansai for だと (quotative).

text: とにかく、外地支部の状況は無事なんだな。 / もう一度くらいを、警察機のクレーターこそ、シャイに判断させる。
translation: Anyway, the situation at the overseas branch is safe, right? / Let's have them assess the police aircraft crater one more time.
grammar: とにかく is used to redirect the conversation, meaning 'anyway' or 'at any rate.'

text: 消滅? / 確かに第二支部が消滅したんだな / はい、全て確認しました / 消滅です
translation: Disappeared? / So the Second Branch really did disappear? / Yes, we've confirmed everything. / It's gone.
grammar: したんだな uses んだ for explanatory tone, with な seeking confirmation.

text: まいったわね / 上野管理部や調査部は大騒ぎ / 総務部はパニクってましたよ / で、原因は? / 未だわからず
translation: This is a disaster. / The management and investigation departments were in an uproar. / The general affairs department was panicking. / So, what's the cause? / Still unknown.
grammar: わからず uses the classical negative ず ending, more literary than わからない.

text: 手がかりはこの静止衛星からの映像だけで / あとは何も残ってないのよ
translation: The only clue is this footage from the geostationary satellite. / Nothing else remains.
grammar: だけで emphasizes 'only this' as the sole evidence available.
Technical countdown using English loanwords, common in scientific/military contexts in anime.

text: ひどいわね / エヴァンゲリオン4号機並びに半径89キロ以内の関連研究施設は全て消滅しました / 数千の人間も道連れにね
translation: That's terrible. / Evangelion Unit-04, along with all related research facilities within an 89-kilometer radius, have disappeared. / Taking several thousand people with it.

vocabulary.meaning: taking someone with you (often to death)

grammar: 並びに is a formal conjunction meaning 'as well as,' used in official statements.

text: タイムスケジュールから推測して / ドイツで修復したS2機関の搭載実験中の事故と思われます
translation: Judging from the time schedule, / it appears to have been an accident during the installation experiment of the S2 engine that was repaired in Germany.
grammar: と思われます is a passive form expressing 'it is thought that...' - objective and formal.

text: 予想される原因は材質の強度不足から設計初期段階のミスまで / 32,768通りです / 妨害工作の線もあるわね
translation: Predicted causes range from insufficient material strength to mistakes in the early design stages - / 32,768 possibilities. / Sabotage is also a possibility.
grammar: から...まで means 'from...to...' showing a range of possibilities.

text: でも爆発ではなく消滅なんでしょ / つまり消えたと / 多分リラックの海に飲み込まれたんでしょうね / さっきの初号機みたく / じゃあせっかく直したエシツ機関も
translation: But it wasn't an explosion - it was annihilation, right? / Meaning it vanished. / It was probably swallowed by the Sea of Dirac. / Just like Unit-01 earlier. / Then the S2 engine we finally repaired is also...
grammar: みたく is casual/colloquial for みたいに, meaning 'like' or 'similar to.'

text: パーよ夢はつい得たわね / よくわからないものを無理して使うからよ / それはエヴァも同じだわ
translation: Gone. Our dream just slipped away. / That's what happens when you force yourself to use something you don't understand. / The same goes for the Eva.
grammar: パー is slang meaning something is completely lost or ruined.
